dublinCore.dc:title: 114 S107 IS: Terminating the Expansion of Too-Big-To-Fail Act of 2015
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Vitter introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

form.official-title: To amend the Financial Stability Act of 2010 to repeal certain designation authority of the Financial Stability Oversight Council, to repeal the Payment, Clearing, and Settlement Supervision Act of 2010, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Terminating the Expansion of Too-Big-To-Fail Act of 2015.

section.header: Repeal of designation authority under the Financial Stability Act of 2010 and the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act

subsection.text: The Financial Stability Act of 2010 (12 U.S.C. 5311 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 102 (12 U.S.C. 5311)—

clause.text: by striking paragraph (4);
by redesignating paragraphs (5) through (7) as paragraphs (4) through (6), respectively; and
by striking paragraph (6) (as redesignated) and inserting the following:

paragraph.text: The term significant bank holding company has the meanings given to it by rule of the Board of Governors.
in section 112 (12 U.S.C. 5322)—

clause.text: in paragraph (1)(A), by striking or nonbank financial companies; and
in paragraph (2)—

subclause.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking and nonbank financial companies;
by striking subparagraphs (H) and (J);
by redesignating subparagraphs (I), (K), (L), (M), and (N) as subparagraphs (H), (I), (J), (K), and (L), respectively;
in subparagraph (H) (as redesignated), by striking nonbank financial companies and;
in subparagraph (I), as so redesignated, by striking , nonbank financial companies,; and
in subparagraph (L), as so redesignated—

item.text: by redesignating clauses (v) and (vi) as clauses (iv) and (v), respectively; and

clause.text: in paragraph (3)—

subclause.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking nonbank financial company or each place the term appears;
in subparagraph (B), by striking nonbank financial company or; and
in subparagraph (C), by striking foreign nonbank financial company or;

clause.text: by striking paragraph (4); and
by redesignating paragraph (5) as paragraph (4);

paragraph.text: in section 115 (12 U.S.C. 5325)—

subparagraph.text: in the section heading, by striking nonbank financial companies supervised by the Board of Governors and;

clause.text: by striking nonbank financial companies supervised by the Board of Governors and; and
in subparagraph (A), by striking nonbank financial companies and;
in paragraph (2)—

subclause.text: in the paragraph heading, by striking financial companies and inserting bank holding companies;
by striking foreign nonbank financial companies supervised by the Board of Governors or; and
in subparagraph (B), by striking foreign nonbank financial company or; and

clause.text: in paragraph (3)—

subclause.text: in subparagraph (A)—

item.text: by striking nonbank financial companies supervised by the Board of Governors and; and
in clause (i), by inserting (as in effect on the day before the date of the enactment of the Terminating the Expansion of Too-Big-To-Fail Act of 2015) before the semicolon; and

subclause.text: in subparagraph (B), by inserting (as in effect on the day before the date of the enactment of the Terminating the Expansion of Too-Big-To-Fail Act of 2015) after section 113;

clause.text: in paragraph (1), by striking nonbank financial companies supervised by the Board of Governors and; and
in paragraph (3)—

subclause.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking any nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors and; and
in subparagraph (B)(iii), by striking a nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors or;

clause.text: in paragraph (1), by striking each nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors and; and
in paragraph (2)—

subclause.text: by striking nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors and; and
by striking significant nonbank financial companies and each place the term appears;

subparagraph.text: in subsection (e), by striking nonbank financial companies supervised by the Board of Governors or;
in subsection (f), by striking and by nonbank financial companies supervised by the Board of Governors; and
in subsection (g), by striking , nonbank financial companies supervised by the Board of Governors,;

paragraph.text: in section 116 (12 U.S.C. 5326)—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking or a nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors; and

clause.text: in paragraph (1)(A), by striking , nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors,; and
in paragraph (2), by striking and nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors;

paragraph.text: in section 117 (12 U.S.C. 5327)—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (b), by striking such entity shall be treated as a nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors, as if the Council had made a determination under section 113 with respect to that entity and inserting for purposes of this title, such entity shall be treated as a bank holding company with total consolidated assets of $50,000,000,000; and

clause.text: in paragraph (1), by striking a nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors and inserting a bank holding company with total consolidated assets of $50,000,000,000; and
in paragraph (2), by striking subparagraph (C);

paragraph.text: in section 119(a)(1) (12 U.S.C. 5329(a)(1)), by striking , nonbank financial company,;
in section 120 (12 U.S.C. 5330)—

clause.text: by striking or nonbank financial companies; and
by striking and nonbank financial companies; and
in paragraph (1), by adding and at the end;
in paragraph (2), by striking ; and and inserting a period; and
by striking paragraph (3);

paragraph.text: in section 121 (12 U.S.C. 5331)—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking , or a nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors,;
in subsection (c), by inserting (as in effect on the day before the date of the enactment of the Terminating the Expansion of Too-Big-To-Fail Act of 2015) after section 113; and

clause.text: in the heading, by striking Foreign financial companies and inserting Foreign-Based bank holding companies;
in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by striking foreign nonbank financial companies supervised by the Board of Governors and; and
by striking paragraph (2) and inserting the following:

paragraph.text: taking into account the extent to which the foreign-based bank holding company is subject on a consolidated basis to home country standards that are comparable to those applied to bank holding companies in the United States.
in the heading for subtitle C, by striking Certain nonbank financial companies and;
in section 155(d) (12 U.S.C. 5345(d)), by striking and nonbank financial companies supervised by the Board of Governors;
in section 163 (12 U.S.C. 5363)—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating subsection (b) as subsection (a); and
in subsection (a), as so redesignated, by striking or a nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors each place the term appears;

paragraph.text: in section 165 (12 U.S.C. 5365)—

subparagraph.text: in the section heading, by striking nonbank financial companies supervised by the Board of Governors and;

clause.text: by striking nonbank financial companies supervised by the Board of Governors and; and
in subparagraph (A), by striking nonbank financial companies and;
in paragraph (1), by striking nonbank financial companies supervised by the Board of Governors and each place the term appears;
in paragraph (2)—

subclause.text: in the paragraph heading, by striking foreign financial companies and inserting foreign-based bank holding companies;
by striking foreign nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors or; and
in subparagraph (B)—

item.text: by striking foreign financial company and inserting foreign-based bank holding company; and
by striking financial companies and inserting bank holding companies;

clause.text: in paragraph (3)—

subclause.text: by inserting (as in effect on the day before the date of the enactment of the Terminating the Expansion of Too-Big-To-Fail Act of 2015) after section 113 each place the term appears; and
in subparagraph (A), by striking nonbank financial companies supervised by the Board of Governors and; and

clause.text: in paragraph (4), by striking a nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors or;
in paragraph (1)—

subclause.text: by striking nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors and; and
by striking bank holding companies and inserting bank holding company; and

clause.text: in paragraph (2)(D), by striking nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors or a;
by striking nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors and each place the term appears;
in paragraph (1), by striking bank holding companies and inserting bank holding company;
in paragraph (2)—

subclause.text: by striking significant nonbank financial companies and each place the term appears; and
by striking bank holding companies and inserting bank holding company;

clause.text: in paragraph (4), by striking a nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors or;
in paragraph (5), by striking a nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors or each place the term appears; and

in paragraph (6), by striking the nonbank financial company supervised by the Board, any bank holding company, or any subsidiary or affiliate of the foregoing and inserting any bank holding company or any subsidiary or affiliate of the bank holding company;
in paragraph (1), by striking a nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors or;
in paragraph (2), by striking nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors and;
in paragraph (3), by striking the nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors or each place the term appears; and
in paragraph (4), by striking a nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors or;

subparagraph.text: in subsection (f), by striking nonbank financial companies supervised by the Board of Governors and;
in subsection (g)(1), by striking and any nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors;

clause.text: by striking paragraph (1);
by redesignating paragraphs (2) and (3) as paragraphs (1) and (2), respectively;
in paragraph (1) (as redesignated), by striking paragraph (3) each place the term appears and inserting paragraph (2); and
in paragraph (2) (as redesignated), by striking nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors or each place the term appears;
in paragraph (1)—

subclause.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking nonbank financial companies supervised by the Board of Governors and; and
in subparagraph (B), by striking and nonbank financial companies; and

clause.text: in paragraph (2)(A), by striking nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors and a;
in paragraph (1), by striking or a nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors; and
in paragraph (2), by inserting (as in effect on the day before the date of the enactment of the Terminating the Expansion of Too-Big-To-Fail Act of 2015) after section 113; and

subparagraph.text: in subsection (k)(1), by striking or nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors;

paragraph.text: in section 166 (12 U.S.C. 5366), by striking a nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors or each place the term appears;
in section 169 (12 U.S.C. 5369), by striking and nonbank financial companies; and
in section 171(b) (12 U.S.C. 5371(b))—

subparagraph.text: by striking , depository institution holding companies, and nonbank financial companies supervised by the Board of Governors each place the term appears and inserting and depository institution holding companies;

clause.text: by striking or nonbank financial companies supervised by the Board of Governors; and
by striking or the primary financial regulatory agency in the case of nonbank financial companies supervised by the Board of Governors; and
by striking or by nonbank financial companies supervised by the Board of Governors each place the term appears; and
in subparagraph (D), by adding a period at the end.

subsection.header: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act
subsection.text: Sections 216 and 217 of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (Public Law 111–203; 124 Stat. 1519) are repealed.

paragraph.text: The Bank Holding Company Act of 1956 (12 U.S.C. 1841 et seq.) is amended—

clause.text: in subsection (a), by striking paragraph (2);
in subsection (b)(2)(B)—

subclause.text: in clause (i)(II), by striking , any nonbank financial company supervised by the Board; and
in clause (ii), by striking and nonbank financial companies supervised by the Board;

clause.text: in subsection (c)(2)—

subclause.text: by striking or nonbank financial company supervised by the Board; and
by striking or 2 years after the date on which the entity or company becomes a nonbank financial company supervised by the Board;

clause.text: in subsection (e)(2), by striking or nonbank financial company supervised by the Board each place the term appears;
in subsection (g), by striking or nonbank financial company supervised by the Board each place the term appears; and
in subsection (h)—

subclause.text: by striking paragraph (3);
by redesignating paragraphs (4) through (7) as paragraphs (3) through (6), respectively; and
in paragraph (3), as so redesignated, by striking or nonbank financial company supervised by the Board each place the term appears; and

clause.text: in paragraph (2)—

subclause.text: by striking subparagraph (E); and
by redesignating subparagraph (F) as subparagraph (E); and

clause.text: in paragraph (3)(C), by striking or other nonbank financial company supervised by the Board.

paragraph.header: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act
paragraph.text: The Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (Public Law 111–203) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the table of contents in section 1(b)—

clause.text: by striking the items relating to sections 113, 114, 161, 162, 164, 167, 170, 216, and 217;
in the item relating to section 115, by striking nonbank financial companies supervised by the Board of Governors and;
in the item relating to subtitle C of title I, by striking certain nonbank financial companies and; and
in the item relating to section 165, by striking nonbank financial companies supervised by the Board of Governors and;
in paragraph (11)(B)—

subclause.text: by striking clause (ii); and
by redesignating clauses (iii) and (iv) as clauses (ii) and (iii), respectively;

clause.text: by striking paragraphs (14) and (15); and
by redesignating paragraph (16) as paragraph (14);

subparagraph.text: in section 210(o)(1)(A) (12 U.S.C. 5390(o)(1)(A)), by striking and any nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors;

clause.text: by striking clause (i); and
by redesignating clauses (ii) through (vi) as clauses (i) through (v), respectively;
by striking subparagraph (B);
by redesignating subparagraph (C) as subparagraph (B); and
in subparagraph (B), as so redesignated—

subclause.text: in the heading, by striking , non-systemically significant institutions not subject to heightened prudential supervision as regulated under section 113 and inserting swaps entities; and
by striking , non-systemically significant institutions not subject to heightened prudential supervision as regulated under section 113;

subparagraph.text: in section 726(a) (15 U.S.C. 8323(a)), by striking a nonbank financial company (as defined in section 102) supervised by the Board, an affiliate of such a bank holding company or nonbank financial company, and inserting an affiliate of such a bank holding company,; and

in section 765(a) (15 U.S.C. 8343(a)), by striking a nonbank financial company (as defined in section 102) supervised by the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, affiliate of such a bank holding company or nonbank financial company, and inserting affiliate of such a bank holding company,.

paragraph.text: Section 10(b)(3) of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act (12 U.S.C. 1820(b)(3)) is amended—

clause.text: by striking or nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors; and
by striking or of such nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors; and

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (B), by striking a nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors or.

paragraph.text: Section 11 of the Federal Reserve Act (12 U.S.C. 248) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating the second subsection (s), as added by section 318(c) of the Enhancing Financial Institution Safety and Soundness Act of 2010 (124 Stat. 1527), as subsection (t); and

clause.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking the semicolon and inserting ; and;
in subparagraph (B), by striking ; and and inserting a period; and
by striking subparagraph (C).

paragraph.text: Section 313(c)(1) of title 31, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating subparagraphs (D) through (H) as subparagraphs (C) through (G), respectively.

section.header: Repeal of the Payment, Clearing, and Settlement Supervision Act of 2010

subsection.text: The Payment, Clearing, and Settlement Supervision Act of 2010 (12 U.S.C. 5461 et seq.) is repealed.
The table of contents in section 1(b) of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (Public Law 111–203) is amended by striking—

paragraph.text: the item relating to title VIII; and
the items relating to sections 801 through 814.
